Question:
What is the defensive strategy called that is designed to deny one specific enemy player by having a defender constantly mark them? 
A) Zone defense 
B) Man-to-man defense 
C) Box-and-one defense 
D) Full-court press

A defensive player commits a major foul if they are found "________" the offensive player. 
A) cheering for
B) holding
C) high-fiving
D) congratulating

In the event of a tie at the end of regulation play in water polo, what method is used to determine the winner? 
A) Sudden death overtime 
B) A penalty shootout 
C) Extra playing periods 
D) A coin toss

In a water polo match, what is the minimum number of officials required for many lower level games? 
A) One referee and one scoring table operator 
B) Two referees and two goal judges 
C) One referee and two people on the scoring table 
D) Two referees and one game/shot clock operator

In American high school water polo, if a game is tied after regulation, how is overtime initially played? 
A) One 5-minute sudden death period 
B) Two 3-minute periods followed by sudden death if necessary 
C) Four 2-minute periods with no sudden death 
D) A shoot-out immediately following the game
